Available on Amazon Kindle, all countries where this service is available. 👇

Thank you!☺️"

"I just finished reading this book by Dr. Craig Blomberg called The Historical Reliability of the New Testament: Countering Challenges to Evangelical Christian Beliefs. So far, the book Ahas been the most jam-packed treatment on the historical evidence for the Bible that I've read (I've read a few books on the historical reliability of the Gospels and on the historical evidence for the resurrection of Jesus Christ but never on the historical reliability of all of the New Testament books in general until this one). Although I do not agree with everything the author says (particularly the way he frames his discussions on Catholicism and/or topics related to it), it's great to see someone defending so-called "conservative"/"traditional" views on scripture (traditional authorship, early dating of the Gospels' composition, etc.) and show that, just because such views may be in the minority, doesn't mean they're false. Personally, I needed to be exposed to Blomberg's perspective because, to be honest, the views on Scripture that I get from my current education is a bit one-sided in a way that fails to disclose the traditional side of the scholarly divide. I highly recommend this to everyone who wants to be exposed to a defense of the historical reliability of the books of Scripture that is both comprehensive and lay-friendly."

"Hi everyone, I just got back from Paris… had a wonderful trip. 
I want to recommend 2 places: 
1. A Michelin star restaurant which is very affordable and amazing. It’s called Restaurant Sadarnac. It’s a small place. Need’s reservations. And they accommodate most dietary restrictions- but you have to tell them ahead of time.                2. L’instant Cacao: it’s a tiny chocolate shop not far from Louvre. Has the very best hot chocolate in town… move over Angelina (great to buy touristy). They have great chocolates, ethically sourced. And the sweetest hosts. 
Not far from here is a gluten free bakery called copain. I had a pie and it was yummmm. Also when people tell youfeance has the best croissants, and you get disappointed eating them in Paris-head outside of Paris.. try the unknown bakeries. They are divine."
"Just got back from France.  This is our third trip to Paris, so we visited our B list of places. Some selected photos. Read the picture captions for more info."

"I recently was able to study abroad through my college and had the amazing chance to learn the culture of London and Paris. It was such a great trip with many amazing sights! One I will never forget and I hope to make it back to Europe one day to see more if such rich history and culture so differnt from ours. Here is just a few of the many pictures I got from from my trip!"

"📸 Life is like a camera, capturing moments worth remembering! 🌟✨
🔍 Focus on what truly matters, and let the rest fade into the background. Remember, it's all about perspective! 💡
🎞️ Embrace the good times, those beautiful memories that light up your soul. Cherish them and hold them close. 🌈💖
🖼️ But hey, life isn't always picture-perfect! Just like developing from negatives, learn from the challenges you face. They shape you into a stronger person! 🌠💪
❌ If things don't go as planned, don't lose hope! Remember, the camera always gives you another chance. Take a deep breath, reset, and give it another shot! 🌻🎯
🌟 So go out there, seize the day, and capture the beauty of life! 🌍✨
#LifeIsLikeACamera #FocusOnWhatMatters #CaptureTheGoodTimes #DevelopFromNegatives #TakeAnotherShot #SeizeTheDay #EmbraceLife #KeepSmiling #StudsRin"
